data.title: Crypto Is a 'Lawless Industry': Better Markets CEO
data.text: Better Markets President and CEO, Dennis Kelleher, says crypto is a 'lawless' industry and former FTX executives should see jail time and be barred from the financial industry for life. He speaks with Sonali Basak and Tim Stenovec on "Bloomberg Crypto.

data.title: BlackRock Debuts its First Tokenized Fund
data.text: BlackRock's tokenized fund has brought in over $240 million since its debut. Carlos Domingo, Securitize Co-Founder & CEO, tells us about his partnership with BlackRock and the significance of the tokenized fund.

data.title: Bankman-Fried sentencing established 'poster child' for crypto fraud
data.text: A federal judge has sentenced former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried to 25 years for defrauding the crypto exchange's (FTT-USD) investors and customer base. Bankman-Fried has been ordered to forfeit $11 billion to compensate the victims.

data.title: Fmr FTX investor weighs in on SBF sentencing, FTX and crypto outlook
data.text: Arjun Sethi, Tribe Capital Co-Founder, joins 'Closing Bell: Overtime' to discuss the Sam Bankman-Fried trial and sentencing and what it means for the crypto industry.

data.title: Hope Scam Artists Continue to Exit Crypto Space: Crypto Council For Innovation CEO
data.text: Crypto Council For Innovation CEO, Sheila Warren, discusses Sam Bankman-Fried's 25 year prison sentence and says she certainly hopes scam artists continue to exit the crypto space, and goes on to say, the sentence is not an indictment of the crypto industry and how it operates, it's about one individual. She speaks with Tim Stenovec and Katie Greifeld on "Bloomberg Crypto.

data.title: Sam Bankman-Fried sentenced to 25 years for FTX fraud: CNBC Crypto World
data.text: CNBC Crypto World features the latest news and daily trading updates from the digital currency markets and provides viewers with a look at what's ahead with high-profile interviews, explainers, and unique stories from the ever-changing crypto industry. On today's show, former federal prosecutor Paul Tuchmann, partner at Wiggin and Dana, and crypto-focused attorney Zack Shapiro, managing partner at Rains Law Firm, provide legal insight into Sam Bankman-Fried's 25-year prison sentence.

data.title: 'Surprised' SBF Sentence Was So Low: O'Melveny Partner, Mermelstein
data.text: O'Melveny Partner, Rebecca Mermelstein, discusses Sam Bankman-Fried's 25 year prison sentence and says she was surprised it was so low. She speaks with Katie Greifeld and Tim Stenovec on "Bloomberg Crypto.

data.title: Sam Bankman-Fried sentenced to 25 years in prison: Here's what you need to know
data.text: Danny Cevallos, NBC News and MSNBC legal analyst, joins 'The Exchange' to discuss what he makes up of Sam Bankman-Fried's sentencing to 25 years in prison.

data.title: Sam Bankman-Fried sentenced to 25 years in prison for FTX fraud
data.text: FTX founder and CEO Sam Bankman-Fried was sentenced to 25 years in prison on Thursday. He faced up 110 years, with prosecutors wanting him to serve 40 to 50 years.

data.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Sentenced To Fraction Of 110 Year Maximum
data.text: Sam Bankman-Fried, the disgraced founder of crypto exchange FTX, was sentenced to 25 years in prison on Thursday following his fraud conviction last fall after his company collapsed, losing up to $10 billion.
